Package polyglot.main

Class OptFlag<T>

java.lang.Object
polyglot.main.OptFlag<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of value parsed by this option.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<OptFlag<T>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
OptFlag.DoubleFlag, OptFlag.IntFlag, OptFlag.PathFlag, OptFlag.Switch
public abstract class OptFlag<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<OptFlag<T>>
An OptFlag represents a command line option. It groups parsing and usage information together so that compilers may easily compose options from multiple extensions.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  OptFlag.Arg<T>
    An argument parsed from the command line.
    static class  OptFlag.DoubleFlag
    A Flag that accepts a integer param.
    static class  OptFlag.IntFlag
    A Flag that accepts a integer param.
    static class  OptFlag.Kind  
    static class  OptFlag.PathFlag<T>
    A OptFlag that accepts a string param with entries separated by the path separator.
    static class  OptFlag.Switch
    A Flag that acts as a boolean switch.

  • Constructor Details

    • OptFlag

      public OptFlag​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String params, java.lang.String usage)
      Parameters:
      id - The flag ID. e.g., "--name", "-n", or "-name".
      params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
      usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."

    • OptFlag

      public OptFlag​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String params, java.lang.String usage, int defaultValue)

      params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
      usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."
      defaultValue - The default value for the flag parameter, to be printed out with help info.

      public OptFlag​(java.lang.String[] ids, java.lang.String params, java.lang.String usage)
      Parameters:
      ids - Flag IDs. e.g., { "--name", "-n", "-name"}. The first one specified will be the one printed out with help info.
      params - A string representing parameters for the flag, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "<hostname>"
      usage - Usage information, to be printed out with help info. e.g., "The name of the node."

    • removeFlag

      public static boolean removeFlag​(java.lang.String id, java.util.Set<OptFlag<?>> flags)
      Remove the flag matching id
      Parameters:
      id - command line flag of the OptFlag to remove
      flags - the list of OptFlags
      Returns:
      true if the id was found

    • handle

      public abstract OptFlag.Arg<T> handle​(java.lang.String[] args, int index) throws UsageError
      Handles a usage flag.
      Parameters:
      args - Arguments from the command line.
      index - The index of the argument following the usage flag.
      Returns:
      The next index to be processed. e.g., if calling this method processes two arguments, then the return value should be index+2.
      Throws:
      UsageError - If an error occurs while handling the usage flag.
